notes: material under the name Prasiola furfuracea is most likely Prasiola borealis. Since P. borealis has type localities of Unalaska and Kodiak Islands, Alaska, whereas P. furfuracea, which is the older name, has a type locality of Denmark, we follow AlgaeBase (Guiry and Guiry 2021) and identify our specimen(s) as P. borealis. Both species are distinguished by cells occurring in groups; they may or may not be infected with a fungus, which turns them black.‚Äù
